newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian shares ease, traders mixed on day's trend.
newsitem.headline: Russian shares ease, traders mixed on day's trend.

text.p: Leading Russian shares dipped in early trade and traders differed on whether the market would steady or ease towards the end of the day.
The Russian Trading System 22-share index opened at 353.29 after closing on Tuesday at 353.99.

Market benchmark UES EESR.RTS eased to $0.2915 at GMT 0900 from $0.2975 at Tuesday's close. Regional energy company Mosenergo MSNG.RTS slipped to $1.345 from $1.385. Oil producer LUKoil LKOH.RTS firmed to $14.750 from $14.730.
"Yesterday evening we saw demand from Russian operators, now they're taking profits," said CentreInvest trader Sergei Bukin.
"But there's no big demand. Volumes are low," he said, adding that he expected buying on the lower prices to provide support for the market to steady towards the end of the day.

Trinfiko trader Ilya Galtsov said Mosenergo was also falling on continuing uncertainty over whether it would issue new shares. The Moscow utility dropped plans for a controversial share issue last month after big investors protested.
He said he saw the market closing slightly lower as Western investors sat out, fearing another interest rate hike coming out of the U.S. Federal Reserve meeting on May 20.
"I see a slight fall compared to yesterday's close. Western investors will be in waiting positions until the end of the week -- not selling, but demand will be very small," Galtsov said.
The Dow Jones industrial index fell 18 points to 7,274 on growing investor speculation about a possible rise in Fed interest rates.
But other traders were optimistic the Russian market would grow again in the long term.
"More people will be back in their offices next week and usually May is very upside -- the atmosphere is very optimistic and we can definitely see a rise," said Bobby Meshoyrer, head trader at Aton.
